text: Brown body, small off white head. Aroma has yeast, spices, bit bananas. Some fudge in flavour.

Bottle 330ml. [ As Pyynikin Tumma Juhlasahti ].Unclear medium orange color with virtually no head. Aroma is moderate malty, wheat, caramel, moderate to heavy yeasty, baking yeast, riped fruit, banana. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet with a long duration, dry, riped fruit - banana, light wood - juniper, yeast. Body is medium to full, texture is oily - creamy, carbonation is flat, finish feel is light alcoholic - phenol. [20150727]

Keg (HBF2015, Helsinki)
Classic hazy coppery brown colour. Nice bananaey aroma. Sweet. Some toffee. A bit sticky, but thats what I demand in a sahti. Alcohol well covered. Surprised to see its 9.5%. A quirky one, rather pleasant.

Aroma is wheat, caramel, some mild bready notes. Flavour is fruity, some mild bananas, yeast and mild spices to it.
Tap @HBF2015. Clear dark brown color. No head. Sweet, rye, caramel, banana in aroma. Alcohol, caramel, malty, faint banana in taste. Alcohol is quite well hidden. Too thin.
Mysterious sample at HBF 2015, Helsinki. Thanks to theanna; Colour is brown with no head. Aromas and flavours: Sweetness, fruits, banana, and malts. Not bad.
HBF15, thanks Anna! Dark brown, thin off white head. Rye bread, sweetness, banana. Flavor has banana, yeast, sweetness, bread. Nice one.

33 cl bottle @ Kerho, Tampere. BBE 03/2015.
Pours murky brown color with no head, lots of yeast on the bottle too as expected. Juniper and bready malts on the nose, some herbs and yeast. Malty, somewhat fruity flavor, faint banana sweetness, some sourish berry notes, spices and yeast. Some mild house flavor can be found also. Alcohol stays hidden. The sourness might be due to mild infection, and its not very fresh, but its not that disturbing here. Not the best Sahti Ive tasted but decent.
4334

Dark brown. Overripe bananas, light chocolate roast, yeasty fruity easters, bit of a rubbery mud cake on nose. Full bodied, light oily texture. Malty sweetness, junipers in flavour, soft roasty, chocolate-banana cake finish. I like the idea. Find it much more approchable than the patent-black sahti beerhunters did. Softer, chocolately. Fits better with the banana esters. Bit rubbery, but nice.-- bb

330 ml bottle at the Kultainen Apina, Hervanta, Finland.
Dark reddish brown colour with a tiny white head. 
Sweet malt, juniper, alcohol and some yeasty notes in the aroma. 
The flavour is alcohol, juniper, sweetness and malt. Thin and alcoholic for a sahti. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33 cl bottle @ Kultainen Apina, BBE 03/2015
Aroma has salmiac, licorice, fruity yeasty tones and some odd, familiar aroma. Also strawberry jam. Flavour has licorice, ashy tones, strawberry jam and tobacco. Finishes with strong juniper notes and warming alcohol kick. Quite ashy stuff.
